description: Two large, plain doors stand before you.  Light and warmth drift
through from the bottom, and voices laugh and sing merrily.  This is
the entrance to the Way Inn.  The weary traveller may find a hearty
meal, a clean bath, and a safe place to rest for a night.
51050.name: The Doorway of the Way Inn

description: The pathway continues north and south here.  To the north the path
ends at the top of the hill overlooking the Trade Way and the village
nearby.  At the end of the path is built a small, quaint house.
Directly east of here is an open shed where the sounds of clanking
metal can be heard.  Smoke rises from the roof, and there is a smell
of something burning in the air.
51040.name: Small Dirt Road

description: A small dirt path leads up to the Way Inn.  Two giant doors stands
before you, leading into the inn.  The Way Inn is known for its good
food, soft beds and a massive training area in the basement of the
inn.  To the south is the Trade Way.
51015.name: Before The Way Inn

description: The dirt path leads off East Street to the west, towards two
buildings to the east.  Directly south is the northern side of the
stables.  East Street stands to the west, and two houses stand to the
east.
51024.name: A Small Dirt Path

description: A small walkway leads down to a blacksmith's shed.  This yard area
has several simple, wooden tables set up and upon them are all manner
of metalwork.  Most all the blacksmith pieces are wall hangings and
small fixture objects, which is strange for a blacksmith of these
parts to be making since demand for weapons and armor is very high in
the realms.  A young boy stands nearby the items, peddling a sale for
his blacksmith master.
51041.name: Outside the Blacksmith's Shed

description: The dirt road continues to the north and south, passing by a small
dirt road to the east.  A large and small house stand to the east at
the end of the dirt path.  The Dirt road here continues to the north
towards a shop.
51022.name: East Street

description: The room is furnished comfortably, but simply, a bed, table and two
chairs take up most of the space in this small room.  A small
fireplace burns low, and a pile of logs lies next to it.  The door
leads back to the hallway.
51081.name: Guest Room One

description: The room is furnished comfortably, but simply, a bed, table and two
chairs take up most of the space in this small room.  A small
fireplace burns low, and a pile of logs lies next to it.  The door
leads back to the hallway.
51085.name: Guest Room Seven

description: A trapdoor lies opened, and a set of stone stairs leads down
underneath the Inn.  The bottom of the staircase cannot be seen, as it
is dimly lit, and the bright light from above cannot penetrate the
darkness.  To the west and east, black iron staircases lead up to the
guest rooms, and the main room lies south.
51089.name: Stairs to the Basement

description: A wrought iron black staircase spirals upwards to the second floor
of the Inn, where the Guest Rooms are located.  To the east, you can
see an identical staircase leading up, and to the south, the main room
of the Inn bustles with voices.
51063.name: Stairs to the 2nd Floor

description: Lit by a single lantern, this room casts long shadows to the
corners, giving the room an eery feeling.  Those not familiar with its
dimensions would be truly intimidated by the uneasy dark spots.  A
small table lies in the center of the room, with two chairs around it.
The door north leads back to the Inn proper.
51055.name: Meeting Room Two

description: The dirt road ends here on the crest of the hill.  To the west The
Way Inn Village stands below, a small village surrounded by a wall.
To the east is a small house stands, not very big at all.  The dirt
road continues south, towards a larger house.
51044.name: Small Dirt Road

description: The Trade Way begins to enter the main part of the village.  The
buildings to either side of the road increase, and the number of
citizens around also increases.  To the north you see a large shop,
with swords and axes in the front window.  To the south is a shrine to
Mielikki, god of nature.  The Trade Way continues to the east and
west.
51007.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: The Trade Way continues here to the north and east.  To the south
stands the Guard Barracks of the small village.  The Trade Way
continues to the east towards all the shops of the village.  To the
north is the Way Inn, and other smaller buildings.
51006.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: A cheery fire roars brightly in a fireplace on the southern end of
the room.  Though comfortable and dry, the room is sparesly furnished,
with just a plain bed, and nightstand.  A old battered lantern sits on
a creaking wooden chair, with a box of matches resting nearby to light
it up.  The door leads back to the hallway north.
51061.name: Guest Room

description: The hallway ends here at a thick stone wall.  To the west is Guest
Room Seven, and to the east is Guest Room Eight.  The whitewashed
hallway leads back north, to the other Guest Rooms, and the staircase
down to the Main Room.
51084.name: 2nd Floor East Hallway

description: Inside this small building is only one room.  A small table sits
next to a window, and a bed, chair, and other peices of furniture.  A
few pictures hang on the wall, but this building is pretty much empty.
51045.name: A Small Home

description: Lines of neatly made cots line the walls of the room.  Pressed
uniforms hang on the walls next to each bunk.
51016.name: Barracks

description: The Trade Way continues to the east and west.  To the west you see
several buildings, one near the road and two further back.  The Gates
of the village are also to the west.  To the east you see more
buildings, and the road leading to The Way Inn.
51004.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: A small narrow hallway goes westward, lit sporadically by torches
on the walls.  Doorways jut out at irregular intervals along each side
of the corridor.  The hallway comes to an abrupt halt nearby to the
west.
51057.name: West Hallway

description: The Trade Way continues to the east and west.  A small dirt path
leads off to the north, towards other small shops and stables and
such.  To the south a small shop stands, and the Trade Way continues
to the east and west.
51009.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: The hill continues upwards towards two houses as the top.  The
small dirt road goes past both houses, on the hill overlooking The Way
Inn Village.  To the south, the dirt road continues to the south and
back to the main road.
51038.name: Small Dirt Road

description: The room is furnished comfortably, but simply, a bed, table and two
chairs take up most of the space in this small room.  A small
fireplace burns low, and a pile of logs lies next to it.  The door
leads back to the hallway.
51078.name: Guest Room Four

description: A large bed sits against the southern wall, flanked by two
nighstands, each holding a lantern.  A full length mirror stands
against the west wall, and facing it on the east wall lies a small
dresser.  The floor is hard and cold, and the rest of the room is
empty.  To the north is the western hallway.
51062.name: Tharmon's Room

description: The Trade Way continues off out of the village of the Way Inn.  The
street turns to the south, leaving the village out of the south gate.
There are only a few citizens of this village around.  To the west is
the main part of the village, containing all the shops and other
building.
51019.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: The room is furnished comfortably, but simply, a bed, table and two
chairs take up most of the space in this small room.  A small
fireplace burns low, and a pile of logs lies next to it.  The door
leads back to the hallway.
51088.name: Guest Room Six

description: Torches line the hallway, burning brightly and merrily.  To west is
Guest Room One, and to the east is Guest Room Two.  The hallway leads
south to Guest Rooms Three and Four, and continues on north.
51076.name: 2nd Floor West Hallway

description: Spacious shelves line the south, west and east walls.  Delicious
odors creep up from the fresh baked goods filling each shelf.  Loaves
of bread, muffins, bagels, and many different pastries wait to be
devoured.  On the floor, bags of flour and sugar sit patiently,
waiting to be turned into scrumptious treats.  The Pantry lies to the
north, with no other visible exits.
51074.name: Dry Food Storage

description: High shelves on the north and south walls hold more supplies and
food.  A heavy metal door leads north, and a delicious order wafts
under the door to the south.  The bustling sounds of the kitchen
filters in through a curtain to the east.  The Inn proper lies through
the Pantry to the west.
51069.name: Pantry

description: This building is sparse, as far as smithy's go.  There is a large
furnace at the back that stretches near across the room.  On one end,
a giant bellows fans the furnace, while on the other, two firepits
keep tools and bar stock red hot for working.  At the center sits
three anvils, two massive iron monstrosities and one smaller anvil for
finer work.  Many tools hang against the far left wall, and on the far
right hang shelves and various finished and half finished works.  The
smithy stands at the center of the room, working a piece of metal.
51020.name: Weapon Smith

description: You enter a brightly lit room with neat tables and shelves.  Along
the far wall, many vials of all shapes, sizes and colors lie, waiting
to be bought.  Large jars of raw materials are stored in low shelves
under the finished potions.  A tidy desk faces the entrance, covered
in neat but high piles of papers.
51014.name: Potion Shop

description: The Trade Way continues to the south and north.  To the south, the
southern gates of The Way Inn stands, and the road continues towards
the south.  To the north stands the village of The Way Inn.  Several
buildings can be seen from this spot, including the very large Way Inn
which sits on a small hill.
51032.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: The hill continues upwards towards two houses as the top.  The
small dirt road goes past both houses, on the hill overlooking The Way
Inn Village.  To the south, the dirt road continues to the south and
back to the main road.
51039.name: Small Dirt Road

description: The hallway ends at a thick stone wall.  Two identical doors stand
north and south.  The north door has a gold plated sign bearing an
ornately carved "R".  The south door is plain, but well polished.
Back east lies the rest of the Inn and the Business Office.
51058.name: West Hallway

description: The small dirt road leads off of the The Trade Way to the south,
and East Street continues to the north.  To the east, a large barn
stands, with the sign "The Way Inn Stables" outside of it.  To the
northeast you can see some houses.  The street continues to the north
towards some shops and other things.
51021.name: East Street

description: Tables and chairs fill this spacious room.  Lanterns and fireplaces
heat and light the chamber, which is filled with patrons eating,
drinking and being merry.  A large staircase lies to the north, and
two smaller doors lie east and south.  Voices carry over from the
west, where the rest of the Main Room extends.
51052.name: The Main Room [East]

description: The crowd around the village is very strong here, many people come
to this spot in the village during the day.  This area is the stomping
grounds of most people, and most of the shops.  To the north you can
see a Pawn Shop.  To the south the home of Glamrallow Sharp.  The
Trade Way continues east and west.
51008.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: A small shack stands here, almost empty except for a table, chair
and bed.  The small building looks like it is used by random fishermen
and other travelers in the area.
51036.name: A Small Shack

description: Torches light the hallway still, two on each side of every door.
To the west is Guest Room Five, and to the east is Guest Room Six.
The hallway ends nearby to the south, with two doors at the very end
of it.
51083.name: 2nd Floor East Hallway

description: The road continues to the north and south, between a very small
house to the north, and a larger house to the southeast.  Down the
hill to the northwest you can see the village of The Way Inn, a quiet
place.  The dirt road continues north and south.
51043.name: Small Dirt Road

description: The dirt path leads into kind of a yard, in which two houses stand.
To the north a small house, more like a shack stands, a few windows
and a door.  To the east a larger house stands, a much richer looking
house.  Directly south you can see a fenced in yard in which the
animals at the Way Inn Stables roam around in.
51025.name: A Small Dirt Path

description: The hill continues upwards towards two houses as the top.  The
small dirt road goes past both houses, on the hill overlooking The Way
Inn Village.  To the south, the dirt road continues to the south and
back to the main road.
51047.name: Small Dirt Road

description: The Trade Way continues to the west, and turns towards the south.
A small dirt path leads north towards The Way Inn, known for its good
food, good rooms, and a basement full of training equipment.  The
center of the village is to the south.
51005.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: The street turns to the east, in which basically main street of the
village is.  To the south a large house stands, owned by Lord
Sparhaver, a resident of this village.  More houses stand to the east,
including most of the shops, and The Way Inn.  To the north is the
gates of the compound. A small road goes west towards a field, and
the Sword Coast.
51002.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: The street continues going to the east and west.  To the north The
Way Inn stands, the largest building within the village.  To the south
a small dirt path leads towards two smaller buildings to the south.
The Trade Way continues to the east and west.
51003.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: Another large firplace lights and heats this cozy antechamber.  A
large bed is in the northwest corner of the room, and ornate and
exotic tapestries line the walls.  Along the entire west wall is a
gigantic closet, closed and locked.  The center of the room is
convered by the thick and soft hide of a bear.  The only obvious way
out is through the west, to Redbeard's parlor.
51060.name: Redbeard's Room

description: A small dirt path leads off the main road back to two houses
towards the rear of the village.  To the west a medium size house
stands.  To the east is the Guard Barracks of the city.
51011.name: Dirt Path

description: The pawn shop sits here with a gruffy old dwarf sitting behind a
log.  In front and around him lay treasures from other travellers
looking to make pocket change.  The dwarf glares around eagerly
looking for someone he can haggle some cash out of.
51018.name: Pawn Shop

description: A small dirt road leads off to the east, towards a hill overlooking
the village to the north.  The main road is back to the west.
51037.name: Small Dirt Road

description: Several stoves are arranged about this large room, and a giant fan
in the ceiling sucks out smoke and steam.  Cooks in white bustle about
with various cooking implements, preparing the Inn's renowned meals.
The pantry and the inn lie to the west, and two doors lie north and
south, leading to secondary store rooms.
51070.name: Kitchen

description: The room is furnished comfortably, but simply, a bed, table and two
chairs take up most of the space in this small room.  A small
fireplace burns low, and a pile of logs lies next to it.  The door
leads back to the hallway.
51080.name: Guest Room Two

description: Just south of the blacksmith's yard is his workshed, a covered area
where sits his furnace, tools, and of course his work anvil.  The
furnace is made of simple stones piled and mortared into an enclosure.
It is black from many years of use.  There is one wall to the back of
the open shed where hangs many more of the blacksmith's pieces.  A
couple of chairs sit just in front of it with a small table nearby
where playing cards are scattered.  At the center of the open shed is
the anvil, set high off the ground for the tall blacksmith to work
upon while standing.  The blacksmith stands directly behind it, wiping
his hands upon his apron as he studies a piece of metal upon his
anvil.
51042.name: The Blacksmith's Shed

description: The room is furnished comfortably, but simply, a bed, table and two
chairs take up most of the space in this small room.  A small
fireplace burns low, and a pile of logs lies next to it.  The door
leads back to the hallway.
51086.name: Guest Room Eight

description: A musty odor wafts about the bookshelves that reach to the top of
the low ceiling.  Each shelf is overflowing with ancient tomes and
texts, and everything is covered in a thick layer of dust.  A few old
wooden tables are lined up, blocking access to the rear bookshelves,
and are piled high with a wide assortment of books, vials, cauldrons,
and other magical trinkets.  The overcrowded room is lighted by a
single lantern, although it strangely gives off more light than it
should...
51013.name: Magic Shop

description: A small barn stands before you, filled with hay and other animals.
The stable is a place to put your horse at night, or if you are in
need of a mount.  The inside looks like a regular barn.  A small table
stands to the north, with the owner of the stables sitting behind it.
51048.name: The Way Inn Stables

description: The dirt road continues north and south along the northeast part of
the small village.  To the south you can see two buildings and one
barn along the road.  To the west you can see The Way Inn.  Directly
north is a shop.
51023.name: East Street

description: The hallway ends here, wth Guestt Room Three to the west, and Gues
Room Four to the east.  To the north lies Guest Rooms One and Two, and
the exit to the first floor of the Inn.
51077.name: 2nd Floor West Hallway

description: The gates open up into a small village known as The Way Inn.  Only
thirteen buildings stand within its walls, but the small village is a
popular spot between the city of Waterdeep to the north, and
Candlekeep to the south.  To the north is the village itself, and all
the buildings, shops and other things.  To the south The Trade Way
continues through wilderness and other parts outside of the village.
51033.name: The {WW{xay {YI{ynn {cV{willag{ce{x

description: Pots, pans and other assorted cooking utensils cover the walls on
small hooks, and the ground is filled with more bags of flour and kegs
of beer and ale.  The door south leads back to the Kitchen.
51071.name: Storage Room

description: Large blocks of ice sit sporadically on the floor, chilling this
room considerably.  All assortments of meat hang from large hooks in
the ceiling.  Sausage, beef, and strange, unrecognizable cuts hang,
glazed over with ice.  Wooden crates on the floor hold more meat
still, of all shapes, sizes, colors and varieties.  The only exit is
south, to the Pantry.
51073.name: Meat Locker

description: The room is furnished comfortably, but simply, a bed, table and two
chairs take up most of the space in this small room.  A small
fireplace burns low, and a pile of logs lies next to it.  The door
leads back to the hallway.
51087.name: Guest Room Five

description: Welcome to the Way Inn, a small village/compound on the Trade Way.
You see only thirteen buildings within the compound, the biggest of
them just east of here, which is The Way Inn itself.  The rest of the
village is made up of people's homes, and a few shops.  The Trade Way
continunes to the south.  To the north, the Trade Way continues
towards the city of Waterdeep, and to the south it continues its way.
51000.name: The {WW{xay {YI{ynn {cV{willag{ce{x

description: A medium size house stands before you, filled with expensive
furniture and other such items.  Welcome to the home of Glamrallow
Sharp, a resident of this small village.  The house stands before you.
51035.name: Home Of Glamrallow Sharp

description: The hallway bends southwards here, and leads to Guest Rooms One
thru Four.  The exit to the first floor is east.
51075.name: 2nd Floor West Hallway

description: The west portion of the Main Room of the Inn is just as brightly
lit and lively as the other two.  Large lanterns cast bright light
throughout the room, and several fireplaces keep the air toasty and
comfortable.  The huge doorway on the east wall leads to the rest of
the Main Room, and two smaller doors lie west and south.  A bulky
staircase dominates the view to the north.
51053.name: The Main Room [West]

description: The street continues further into the quiet village.  To the north
the large gates of the village stand, and the Way Inn continues north
for many miles towards the city of Waterdeep.  It continues southwards
through the village of The Way Inn.
51001.name: {r@{m={xThe {yTrade {WWay{m={r@{x through the {WW{xay {YI{ynn{x

description: A wrought iron black staircase spirals upwards to the second floor
of the Inn, where the Guest Rooms are located.  To the west, you can
see an identical staircase leading up, and to the south, the main room
of the inn bustles with voices.
51064.name: Stairs to the 2nd Floor

description: The hallway bends southward.  A beat up rusty sign points south,
indicating Guest Rooms Five thru Eight.  Back west is the stairs down
to the Main Room of the Inn.
51082.name: 2nd Floor East Hallway

description: Pots, pans and other assorted cooking utensils cover the walls on
small hooks, and the ground is filled with more bags of flour and kegs
of beer and ale.  The door north leads back to the Kitchen.
51072.name: Storage Room

description: You enter a long hallway, leading east and west.  A sign indicates
the Way Inn's Guest Rooms, and shows the Rooms 1-4 lie to the west,
and rooms 5-8 lie to the east.  Torches line the whitewashed walls and
brighten the hallway nicely, although the air is a bit chilly.
51067.name: 2nd Floor West Hallway

description: The room is furnished comfortably, but simply, a bed, table and two
chairs take up most of the space in this small room.  A small
fireplace burns low, and a pile of logs lies next to it.  The door
leads back to the hallway.
51079.name: Guest Room Three

description: The clutter in this large room makes it seem deceivingly small.
Piles of paper and extra supplies seem on the verge of toppling over.
Under the papers piled high to the ceiling, two small desks lie,
nearly hidden.  A lantern with careful shielding to protect the heat
source from igniting the whole room casts a dim glow and long shadows.
A door can be seen to the west, though partially blocked by kegs of
ale.
51056.name: Business Office

description: This small room is lit by torches on each of the four walls.  With
no heating source of its own, it is decidedly cooler in here, although
still relatively comfortable.  It is simply furnished, baring only a
round wooden table and two crudely made wooden chairs.  Each of the
walls are thick, effectively keeping out prying ears from important
business matters...
51054.name: Meeting Room One

description: The dirt path comes to the end here, and you see two buildings to
either side of you.  This is the rear of the village, you see nothing
more in this area of the village.
51012.name: Dirt Path

description: High shelves stand from floor to ceiling, holding all of the Inn's
spare supplies.  Towels, linens, and tablecloths share space with
candles, lantern oil, torches, and jars of food.  The south wall is
lined with kegs of ale on the floor, and shelves full of bottles of
liquor.  A door leads farther into the pantry to the east.  The Main
Room lies west.
51068.name: Pantry

description: You enter a long hallway, leading east and west.  A sign indicates
the Way Inn's Guest Rooms, and shows that Rooms 1-4 lie to the west,
and rooms 5-8 lie to the east.  Torches line the whitewashed walls and
brighten the hallway nicely, although the air is a bit chilly.
51065.name: 2nd Floor East Hallway

description: A roaring fireplace warms this comfortably sized parlor.  Books of
all subjects overflow off of a huge bookcase on the north wall, and
thick rugs cover every inch of the floor.  A small desk is piled high
with papers on the east wall, and just north of it on the same wall
lies another door.  In the center of the room lies a massive armchair,
plush and very inviting.  This is where the owner of the Inn resides
while not working.
51059.name: Redbeard's Parlor

description: The Main Room of the Way Inn is divided into three huge sections,
each with many tables and chairs spread about.  Patrons lounge about,
drinking and being merry.  Two large empty doorways lead to the other
parts of the Main Room, one to the west and one to the east.
51051.name: The Main Room of the Inn

description: The hallway extends far to the west and far to the east.  In both
direction, stairs to the bottom floor can be seen, and light and
warmth filter up from the main room of the Inn.
51066.name: 2nd Floor Hallway

description: A medium size house stands before you, filled with furniture and
such items that a well paid person would get.  This is the home owned
by Lord Sparhaver, a resident of The Way Inn Village.
51010.name: Home Of Lord Sparhaver

description:
Meten is a large fellow, with wide shoulders and bulging muscles. 
He wears a rather small apron for his size, but the apron is normal. 
It is he that is large.  He wields a simple smithing hammer and works
his metal on a simple tempered iron anvil.  Several of his pieces lie
about.  Few of them are of weapons and armor.  Strangely enough,
nearly all of his creations are decorative fixtures, yokes, and
fastens.
51000.name: Meten the Blacksmith~
subroutines:
M speech 51001 staff of revelation~
M act 51004 nods at you~
M speech 51002 courage~
M speech 51002 courageous~
M give 51003 wand orb~
M give 51003 55789~
M give 51003 fragment phylactery~

description:
The boy is young, his face is black with soot and beneath it he
smiles.  He seems to like his job as the blacksmith's servant, or as
he would call it, his apprentice.  He wears a small leather belt from
which hangs mini smithing tools of his own: a hammer, working iron,
and several furnace spikes.  A loose fitting tunic covers him, also
tattered and covered in soot.
51001.room_name: A small boy stand by the tables, selling things for the blacksmith.
51001.name: A small boy~

51002.room_name: A test mobile created for Michelson to test mprogs stands here.
51002.name: {YMi{ych{8el{yso{Yn's {RT{rest {GM{gobile {c({yThe Way Inn{c){x~
subroutines:
M speech 51006 test~
M speech 51007 check~

description:
He is tall and sweaty--a human most likely from the upper lands as
evident by his full beard and weathered skin.  He drives the hammer
down as if it were a bundle of straw.  He barely grits at the resonant
clash of metal upon metal.  His overalls are burned and torn, but they
fit him like a glove, from many years of use.
51003.room_name: {WG{8e{wn{8l{wy{x the {WW{8eaponsmith{x stands here hammering on a piece.
51003.name: {WG{8e{wn{8l{wy{x~
subroutines:
M speech 51010 platinum boots~
M speech 51010 platinum studded boots~
M speech 51011 platinum orb~
M give 51014 18201~
M grall 51012 100~
M speech 51009 make the boots~
M speech 51009 make me the boots~

description:
Memphis is sitting behind his various armors and swords counting
his stack of coins.  Continually he check to make sure everything is
in order and to look for vulnerable suspects.
51018.name: the dwarven shopkeeper~
51018.keywords: memphis pawn shop merchant dwarven shopkeeper~
